medium_description_en: Predicts outcomes, especially in pediatric patients; helps determine need for ECMO.

seo.meta_description_en: The Oxygenation Index Predicts outcomes, especially in pediatric patients by helping to determine need for ECMO.
seo.keywords_en: Oxygenation index, oxygen index, peds oxygenation index, peds oxygen index, parital pressure O2 kids, partial pressure oxygen kids, parital pressure o2 index, pediatric oxygenation index, o2 index peds, o2 index pediatrics, mean airway pressure calc, mean airway pressure oxygen index, oxygenation index calc, airway pressure index, oxygenation calc

how_to_use.use_case_en: Used in pediatrics to define ALI and ARDS and assess for potential ECMO treatment.

about.formula_en:
Oxygenation index = (FiO2 x PAW) / PaO2

where variables are as follows:

  • FiO2 = fraction of inhaled oxygen, %
  • PAW = mean airway pressure, mm Hg
  • PaO2 = Partial pressure of arterial oxygen, mm Hg

Original/Primary Reference.text: Trachsel D, McCrindle BW, Nakagawa S, Bohn D. Oxygenation index predicts outcome in children with acute hypoxemic respiratory failure. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2005 Jul 15;172(2):206-11. Epub 2005 Apr 7. PubMed PMID: 15817802.

creator_info.about_en: Robert H. Bartlett, MD, is Professor Emeritus of General Surgery at the University of Michigan. As Professor of Surgery in the Sections of General and Thoracic Surgery, he developed a Surgical Critical Care Fellowship and the Extracorporeal Life Support Program. Dr. Bartlett’s cutting edge research includes the development of an artificial liver system for use in patients awaiting liver transplant.
